snippet: Poor communication and a chaotic scene after the 2012 theater shootings in Aurora made it difficult for medical personnel to reach the most badly injured victims and get them to hospitals, according to a study released Wednesday.
abstract: Study conducted by consulting firm TriData says poor communication and chaotic scene after 2012 theater shooting in Aurora made it difficult for medical personnel to reach badly injured victims and get them to the hospital; also concludes that problems did not cause any loss of life.
lead_paragraph: Poor communication and a chaotic scene after the 2012 theater shootings in Aurora made it difficult for medical personnel to reach the most badly injured victims and get them to hospitals, according to a study released Wednesday.

headline.main: Colorado: Study Lauds Response to Theater Shooting
headline.print_headline: Colorado: Study Lauds Response to Theater Shooting
